title: Australian Internet
body: Thanks to Australian internet, I am now in a low priority queue and on the verge of going down a rank. Nothing i can do about it and i get punished for it. I'm not blaming Riot but surely I'm not to blame here. I mean come on, my internet drops out + huge lag spikes so it's gg for me and to put the cherry on top i get put in a lower priority queue. Yay so happy right now.

replies.body: Dont blame riot. Blame tone abet and get all your friends and family to punish him next election.

> I'm not blaming Riot but surely I'm not to blame here.

Well sure, unless you consider the TOU and EULA, both of which you would've agreed to when you made an account. Both state that it is solely the players responsibility to ensure their computer meets the software, hardware and **connection** requirements of the game. The fact that you have been hit with LPQ suggests that is certainly not the case.
I understand that but what I'm trying to say is that I have no control over my internet connection and when it does lag out or crash completely it is incredibly frustrating for me.

True, but you do have control over whether you play a game that explicitly states it **requires** a stable connection. If you're DCing often enough to get hit with LPQ then obviously your connection isn't stable enough for an online game. Either that or you choose to continue playing when you know it's not stable.
Are homeless people to blame for not having a computer and internet to obtain a rank with?

> [{quoted}](name=xuzhinhen,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=cOTokikO,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-08-27T03:12:27.769+0000)
>
> Are homeless people to blame for not having a computer and internet to obtain a rank with?

depends on why they're homeless.
Boycott Telstra for providing us with terribad internet speeds and stability.

unless it's riots fault, you're held responsible.
so yes, you are to blame.
I'm in Wifi 40Mbps and never get lag or DC's.
